mip.description: GeoMIP experiments apply geoengineering methods that modify stratospheric sulfate aerosol, solar irradiance and cirrus clouds to specified DECK and ScenarioMIP experiments.
mip.keywords: geoengineering, sulphur injection, solar, cirrus, albedo
mip.label: GeoMIP
mip.rationale: Assessing the climate system response (including on extreme events) to proposed radiation modification geoengineering schemes by evaluating their efficacies, benefits, and side effects.

G6SST2-sulfur.description: Time slice at year 2100 of GeoMIP G6sulfur. Run for 10 years.
G6SST2-sulfur.long_name: SSTs from year 2100 of SSP5-8.5; forcings and other prescribed conditions from year 2100 of G6sulfur
G6SST2-sulfur.rationale: To assess radiative forcing of G6sulfur after 80 years of simulation.

G1.description:
Extended version of GeoMIP experiment G1 (Kravitz et al., 2011).
Beginning from a preindustrial control simulation (picontrol) the net top of atmospehere (TOA) radiative flux imbalance due to an abrupt quadruping of the CO2 concentration (abrupt4xCO2) would be balanced via a reduction in total solar irradiance. Here, "balance" is defined as  the global mean value of top-of-atmosphere net radiative flux being within ±0.1 W/m2 of the piControl experiment over an average of years 1-10 of the simulation. 
The G1ext experiment should be run for 50 years, however modelling groups that are not able to extend their previous (G1) model simulation should run experiment G1ext for the full 100 years.
G1.keywords: GeoMIP, Tier 1, G1ext, solar irradiance reduction, abrupt 4xCO2, balance TOA, G1
G1.long_name: abrupt quadrupling of CO2 plus reduction in total solar irradiance
G1.rationale: To assess extreme events and longer term climate varability in an idealized geoengineering scenario. G1ext will be highly synergistic with single-forcing experiments to be included in the Cloud Feedback MIP (CFMIP) in which total solar irradiance is abruptly increased or decreased. Through comparisons with the CFMIP experiments, G1ext will enable a better understanding of how the Earth System responds to radiative forcing.

ssp245.description: SSP-based RCP scenario with medium radiative forcing by the end of the century.  Following approximately RCP4.5 global forcing pathway with SSP2 socioeconomic conditions. Radiative forcing reaches a level of 4.5 W/m2 in 2100. Concentration-driven.
ssp245.keywords: ScenarioMIP, Tier 1, Scenario, SSP, RCP, SSP2, RCP4.5, future,  Medium forcing, SSP-based RCP
ssp245.long_name: update of RCP4.5 based on SSP2
ssp245.rationale: The scenario represents the medium part of the range of plausible future pathways.

G6sulfur.description: Injection of sulfate aerosol precursors in the equatorial stratosphere to reduce the radiative forcing of the ScenarioMIP high forcing scenario (SSP5-85) to match that of the ScenarioMIP medium forcing scenario (SSP2-45).   Geoengineering will be simulated over years 2020 to 2100.
G6sulfur.keywords: GeoMIP, Tier 1, G6sulfur, G6sulfate, SSP585 to SSP245
G6sulfur.long_name: stratospheric sulfate aerosol injection to reduce net forcing from SSP585 to SSP245
G6sulfur.rationale:
To evaluate a climate in which geoengineering is used to only partially offset climate change in order to reduce the burden of adaptation. 
Assess the climate effects and inter-model variations of a limited amount of geoengineering as part of a portfolio of responses to climate change.  
Results to be compared with G6solar to determine differences between sulfate aerosol effects and solar irradiance effects.

abrupt-4xCO2.description: Impose an instantaneous quadrupling of the concentration of atmospheric carbon dioxide, then hold fixed.
abrupt-4xCO2.keywords: CMIP, Tier 1, DECK, Diagnosis Evaluation and Characterization of Klima (Climate), 4xCO2, instantaneous quadrupling, climate sensitivity
abrupt-4xCO2.long_name: Abrupt quadrupling of the atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide
abrupt-4xCO2.rationale: To evaluate the equilibrium climate sensitivity of the model and to diagnose the strength of various feedbacks.  To characterise the radiative forcing that arises from an increase in atmospheric CO2 as well as changes that arise indirectly due to the warming.

G6SST2-solar.description: Time slice at year 2100 of GeoMIP G6solar. Run for 10 years.
G6SST2-solar.long_name: SSTs from year 2100 of SSP5-8.5; forcings and other prescribed conditions from year 2100 of G6solar
G6SST2-solar.rationale: To assess radiative forcing of G6solar after 80 years of simulation.

G7cirrus.description: Against a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing (SSP5-85), reduce cirrus cloud optical depth by a constant amount. Geoengineering will be simulated over years 2020 to 2100.
G7cirrus.keywords: GeoMIP, Tier 1, G7cirrus, decrease SSP585 by 1 W m-2
G7cirrus.long_name: G7cirrus ­ increase cirrus ice crystal fall speed to reduce net forcing in SSP585 by 1 W m-2
G7cirrus.rationale:
To seed cirrus by a constant amount that reduces average global mean temperature in the decade 2020-2029 to that of the decade 1970-1979 (as calculated in a historical run), offsetting a radiative forcing of approximately 1.0 W/m2. 
To assess robust model response regarding the climate effects of cirrus cloud thinning. 
To explore inter-model differences in the results can reveal sources of model biases.

G7SST1-cirrus.description: Time slice at year 2020 of GeoMIP G7cirrus. Run for 10 years.
G7SST1-cirrus.long_name: SSTs from year 2020 of SSP5-8.5; forcings and other prescribed conditions from year 2020 of SSP5-8.5 + cirrus thinning
G7SST1-cirrus.rationale: To assess radiative forcing of G7cirrus at the beginning of the simulation (2020).

G6solar.description: Using solar irradiance reduction, return the radiative forcing from a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing (SSP5-85) to the ScenarioMIP middle forcing (SSP2-45).  Geoengineering will be simulated over years 2020 to 2100.
G6solar.keywords: GeoMIP, Tier 1, G6solar, SSP585 to SSP245
G6solar.long_name: total solar irradiance reduction to reduce net forcing from SSP585 to SSP245
G6solar.rationale: To determine the differential effects of sulfate aerosols and solar irradiance reduction, in comparison with G6sulfur.

ssp460.description: SSP-based RCP scenario with medium radiative forcing by the end of the century.  Following approximately RCP6.0 global forcing pathway with SSP1 socioeconomic conditions. Radiative forcing reaches a level of 6.0 W/m2 in 2100. Concentration-driven.
ssp460.keywords: ScenarioMIP, Tier 2, Scenario, SSP, RCP, SSP4, RCP6.0, future, Medium forcing, SSP-based RCP
ssp460.long_name: update of RCP6.0 based on SSP4
ssp460.rationale: The scenario fills in the range of medium forcing plausible future pathways. The scenario defines the low end of the forcing range for unmitigated SSP baseline scenarios.

piSST-4xCO2-solar.description: Time slice for the first year of the GeoMIP G1 experiment with fixed sea surface temperature climatology calculated from the piControl. Run for 10 years.
piSST-4xCO2-solar.long_name: preindustrial control SSTs with quadrupled CO2 + solar reduction
piSST-4xCO2-solar.rationale:
To enable the separate calculation of the rapid adjustments and the (slow) feedback response of the climate system to the abrupt4xCO2 plus G1 geoengineering scenario. 
To assess the radiative forcing of abrupt4xCO2 plus G1 geoengineering.

G7SST2-cirrus.description: Time slice at year 2100 GeoMIP G7cirrus.  Run for 10 years.
G7SST2-cirrus.long_name: SSTs from year 2100 of SSP5-8.5; forcings and other prescribed conditions from year 2100 of G7cirrus
G7SST2-cirrus.rationale: To assess radiative forcing of G7cirrus after 80 years of simulation.

futureSST-4xCO2-solar.description: Time slice at year 100 of the GeoMIP G1 experiment with fixed sea surface temperature climatology calculated from the abrupt-4xCO2 experiment after 100 years. Run for 10 years.
futureSST-4xCO2-solar.long_name: year 100 SSTs from abrupt4xCO2 with quadrupled CO2 + solar reduction
futureSST-4xCO2-solar.rationale:
To enable the separate calculation of the rapid adjustments and the (slow) feedback response of the climate system to the abrupt4xCO2 plus G1 geoengineering scenario. 
To assess the radiative forcing of abrupt4xCO2 plus G1 geoengineering.

ssp585.description: SSP-based RCP scenario with high radiative forcing by the end of century. Following approximately RCP8.5 global forcing pathway with SSP5 socioeconomic conditions. Concentration-driven.
ssp585.keywords: ScenarioMIP, Tier 1, Scenario, SSP, RCP, SSP5, RCP8.5, future, High forcing, SSP-based RCP
ssp585.long_name: update of RCP8.5 based on SSP5
ssp585.rationale: The scenario represents the high end of plausible future pathways. SSP5 is the only SSP with emissions high enough to produce the 8.5 W/m2 level of forcing in 2100.

piControl.description: A pre-inudsutrial control simulation with non-evolving pre-industrial conditions. Conditions chosen to be representative of the period prior to the onset of large-scale industrialization, with 1850 being the reference year.  The piControl starts after an initial climate spin-up, during which the climate begins to come into balance with the forcing. The recommended minimum length for the piControl is 500 years.
piControl.keywords: CMIP, Tier 1, DECK, Diagnosis Evaluation and Characterization of Klima (Climate), pre-industrial, reference, control, climate,
piControl.rationale: Control experiment against which perturbations are compared, it serves as a baseline for experiments that branch from it.  To allow us to determine unforced model variability.  The control experiment should be long enough to extend to the furthest point in time reached by the end of the perturbation experiments,  thus the control should allow us to subtract any residual, unforced drift from all perturbation simulations.

G6SST1.description: Time slice for the first year of the ScenarioMIP SSP5-85 (high forcing scenario) experiment. Run for 10 years.
G6SST1.long_name: SSTs, forcings, and other prescribed conditions from year 2020 of SSP5-8.5
G6SST1.rationale: To assess radiative forcing of G6sulfur and G6solar at the beginning of the simulation (2020).

81yrs2020-2100.description: Scenario, from 2020 to the end of the 21st century
81yrs2020-2100.label: 2020-2100 81yrs

ssp5-85Initialisation2020.description: Initialisation is from the beginning of year 2020 of the SSP5-8.5 experiment.
ssp5-85Initialisation2020.keywords: initial conditions, initialisation, ssp5-8.5, year 2020, scenario
ssp5-85Initialisation2020.label: SSP5-85Initialisation2020

AOGCMconfiguration.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model
AOGCMconfiguration.label: AOGCM Configuration

AGCMConfiguration.description: An Atmosphere only general circulation model configuration.
AGCMConfiguration.label: AGCM Configuration

FutureSolarParticleForcing.description: Future solar particle forcing (2015-2299). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
FutureSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Future, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
FutureSolarParticleForcing.label: Future Solar Particle Forcing

piSolarIrradiance.data_link: SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMIP6
piSolarIrradiance.description: Pre-Industrial solar forcing. The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which includes pre-industrial solar forcing (1850-1873 mean).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.
piSolarIrradiance.keywords: Solar Forcing, pre-industrial, pi, Solar, Spectral Irradiance, SSI, TSI
piSolarIrradiance.label: Pre-Industrial Solar Irradiance Forcing

solarRCP85-RCP45.description: Reduce solar irradiance to reduce the radiative forcing of ScenarioMIP high forcing scenario (SSP5-85) to match that of the ScenarioMIP medium forcing scenario (SSP2-45).
solarRCP85-RCP45.keywords: GeoMIP, solar mitigation, SSP5-85 to SSP2-45, solar irradiance reduction
solarRCP85-RCP45.label: Solar RCP85 to RCP45

piSolarParticleForcing.description: Pre-Industrial solar particle forcing (1850-1873 mean). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
piSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Pre-Industrial, pi, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
piSolarParticleForcing.label: Pre-Industrial Solar Particle Forcing

SSP5-85SST2020.description: Sea surface temperature climatology calculated from the ScenarioMIP SSP5-85 experiment for the year 2020.
SSP5-85SST2020.label: SSP5-85 SST 2020

stratAerPreRCP85-RCP45internal.description:
Injection of stratospheric sulfate aerosol precursors to reduce the radiative forcing of ScenarioMIP high forcing scenario (SSP5-85) to match that of the ScenarioMIP medium forcing scenario (SSP2-45).  
Modeling groups that have an internal sulfate aerosol treatment should calibrate the radiative response to sulfate aersols individually so that the results will be internally consistent (a procedure that will be more difficult for models that have a complex microphysical treatment of aerosols). Potential methods include a double radation call, once with and once without the stratospheric aerosols, and also the use feedback methods.
Simulations to be conducted as if the aerosols or aerosol precursors are emitted in a line from 10°S to 10°N along a single longitude band (0°).  The injected aerosols or aerosol precursors should be evenly spread across model layers between 18 and 20 km.  Note that sedimentation processes and self-lofting due to heating are likely to result in the aerosols being distributed between 16-25 km in altitude.
stratAerPreRCP85-RCP45internal.keywords: GeoMIP, sulfate mitigation, SSP5-85 to SSP2-45, internal aerosol treatment, stratospheric aerosol precursor injection
stratAerPreRCP85-RCP45internal.label: Internal Stratospheric Aerosol Precursors RCP85 to RCP45

rcp85Forcing.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 8.5, future, 21st century, SSP5, RCP8.5
rcp85Forcing.label: RCP85 Forcing

stratAerPreRCP85-RCP45external.description:
Injection of stratospheric sulfate aerosol precursors to reduce the radiative forcing of ScenarioMIP high forcing scenario (SSP5-85) to match that of the ScenarioMIP medium forcing scenario (SSP2-45).  
For modeling groups that have no dynamical treatment of sulfate aerosols, GeoMIP will provide a data set of aerosol optical depth, as well as ozone fields that are consistent with this aerosol distribution.  Note that the amount of sulfate injection needed for a given model to achieve the goals of this experiment may vary, so modeling groups should scale the aerosol and ozone perturbation fields as necessary.
Simulations to be conducted as if the aerosols or aerosol precursors are emitted in a line from 10°S to 10°N along a single longitude band (0°).  The injected aerosols or aerosol precursors should be evenly spread across model layers between 18 and 20 km.  Note that sedimentation processes and self-lofting due to heating are likely to result in the aerosols being distributed between 16-25 km in altitude.
stratAerPreRCP85-RCP45external.keywords: GeoMIP, sulfate mitigation, SSP5-85 to SSP2-45, external aerosol data input, stratospheric aerosol precursor injection
stratAerPreRCP85-RCP45external.label: External Stratospheric Aerosol Precursors RCP85 to RCP45

150yrs1850-1999.description: Begin in 1850 and run for 150 years.
150yrs1850-1999.label: 1850-1999 150yrs

These should be prescribed according to the AMIP protocols, whereby interpolated daily data are generated preserving the prescribed monthly average fields.
PIControlSSTClim.keywords: pre-industrial control, SST, sea surface temperature, climatology

Specifically, the global mean value of top-of-atmosphere net radiative flux must lie within ±0.1 W/m2 of the piControl experiment over an average of years 1-10 of the simulation.
solarBalance4xCO2.label: Solar Balance of 4xCO2

increaseCirrusSedimentationVelocity.description:
Add a local variable that replaces (in all locations where temperature is colder than 235K) the ice mass mixing ratio in the calculation of the sedimentation velocity with a value that is eight times the original ice mass mixing ratio.
Cirrus seeding to begin in 2020 and continue through to the year 2100.
increaseCirrusSedimentationVelocity.keywords: GeoMIP, cirrus thinning, increase cirrus sedimentation velocity
increaseCirrusSedimentationVelocity.label: Increase Cirrus Sedementation Velocity

abrupt-4xCO2SIC100.description: Sea ice concentration climatology calculated from the DECK abrupt-4xCO2 experiment after 100 years.
abrupt-4xCO2SIC100.label: abrupt-4xCO2 SIC year 100

rcp45Forcing.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 4.5, future, 21st century, SSP2, RCP4.5
rcp45Forcing.label: RCP45 Forcing

These should be prescribed according to the AMIP protocols, whereby interpolated daily data are generated preserving the prescribed monthly average fields.
PIControlSICClim.keywords: pre-industrial control, SIC, sea ice, sea ice concentration, climatology
PIControlSICClim.label: piControl SIC Climatology
